Plus’ industry awards include from Fast Company, Insider, Consumer Electronics, AUVSI, and others. Based in Silicon Valley, Plus is looking for talented individuals to join its fast-growing teams.
 
Delivering high-quality and innovative technology solutions is only possible with a strong backbone of continuous testing, integration and deployment process, as well as developer and production tools and infrastructure.
As a Senior Release Engineer, you will be responsible for refining, improving and furthering the evolution of Plus' software development and delivery process. You will focus on building, testing, validating, deploying and running the autonomous driving system and related tools, efficiently tying together the work of all interdisciplinary teams, ensuring final product robustness and smooth on-vehicle operation.
What we expect you to bring to the team:

3+ years of release engineering experience.
1+ years of experience working on CI/CD pipelines and tools.
Solid understanding of the Linux OS fundamentals.
Python coding and shell scripting.
Familiar with C++.

Perks

Work on industry-leading technologies at an energetic, exciting Silicon Valley startup
Forge the future of autonomous transportation while collaborating with AI experts from around the world
Catered free lunch, unlimited snacks and beverages
Competitive salary and outstanding benefits package

Product Manager - Connectivity

REMOTE (CANADA OR US) /
PRODUCT – PRODUCT MANAGEMENT /
FULL TIME


 




Who we are
Our mission at Nylas is to turn communication into inspiration and insight. We empower over 100,000 developers and over 900 companies all over the world to access, parse, and gain insights from communications data to provide better experiences for their customers and users, all while providing top tier security and compliance. To achieve this vision, we’ve raised over $175M from Tiger Global, 8VC, ScaleUp, Spark Capital, Slack, and more.
 
We have a huge market (every company that builds software) and a massive opportunity (the world runs on communication and data). By continuing to hire exceptional people from all different backgrounds and perspectives, we have the opportunity to make Nylas one of the biggest, most successful and equitable technology companies in the world. 
 
Why Nylas
Nylas is an advocate for the well-being of our employees. We trust our employees and give them the autonomy to achieve their goals without focusing on when, where, and how they get there. We are a flexibility first workplace. That means if you have a preference for working fully remote, going into the office every day, or anywhere in between, we support that working style. but if Nylanauts want to work from an office, we have hubs in San Francisco, Denver, New York City, Toronto, and London.
 
We are also strong supporters of internal and cross-team mobility and growth. We want Nylas to be a place where anyone can be supported to grow, learn, and become the best at what they do. We’ve been named a top Startup for career growth and development by Forbes, Great Places to Work, and Comparably!
 
From our CTO + Co-Founder, Christine Spang:
“We have a number of folks on the team who started as an individual contributor and became staff level or leaders in their area. I personally love seeing people reach their full potential and become successful at Nylas.”
 
About the team
The Nylas Connectivity team builds APIs, tools, and applications with various communication channels to extract data and insights to help improve and automate workflows for our customers. We’re looking for a Product Manager to join the team to support the existing platform while building new capabilities and features to accelerate growth and adoption within enterprise companies.



Responsibilities


Collaborate with leadership to develop our product strategy and roadmap for your product line
Full end-to-end ownership over launching new products and features within our Connectivity suite - Email, Calendar, and Omnichannel (Voice, Messaging, Collaboration, and more)
Work collaboratively with every department to launch high-quality products on time
Own product documentation and work with product marketing to communicate both internally and externally about new products and features
Analyze product feedback, meet with customers, and run closed-betas with partners to help inform product direction and priorities
Research and validate assumptions, making product decisions quickly— even with imperfect data






Qualifications


You have 3+ years of product management experience working with technical products, preferably with APIs, data transformations, and developer platforms
Experience collaborating with Engineering teams to outline product requirements and outline trade-offs and risks
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can get a lot done with minimal direction
Your curiosity is boundless and you’re always looking for opportunities to improve the product
You’re comfortable talking to engineers about code and can read technical documentation to create product requirements but can also talk business value and use cases to develop GTM in collaboration with product marketing
You have the ability to dive into details when executing while constantly reviewing the big picture to make sure priorities are correct
You have excellent communication skills and have experience working with distributed teams





 
 
Not sure if this is you?
We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application and will either move forward with your application, find another team that might be better suited to your skills, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.
 
Perks and Benefits:
• Nylas Alumni Fund: after 3 years employment, Nylas will invest $20k into your seed round if you decide to start your own company
• Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO): we take this very seriously as we care about the well-being of our employees
• CPP with 3% employer contribution
• Education Stipend: $1,250 annual education & development benefit
• Perk card: $180 per month towards health, wellness, and other perks via Assembly
• Cell Phone: $60 per month stipend towards cell phone reimbursement

Senior Research Engineer / Research Engineer - Mechatronics, Hardware, and Design
 
Role Summary:
As a Senior Research Engineer / Research Engineer - Mechatronics, Hardware, and Design at UBTECH North America Research and Development Center (UBTECH NARDC), you will work with our talented team members to contribute to our innovative research development for our next-generation service robotic product. This role reports to the head of the Department of Hardware and Design.
 
Job Type: Full-Time
 
Essential Responsibilities:
• Work as a key technical member and technical leader of mechanical design in the Hardware and Design team.
• Work with the local and global business, product, and R&D teams to define the requirements of the mechatronics and hardware of our new robot product. Convert the designs into technical development requirements.
• Work with our collaborators, vendors, and members to design and implement the mechanical and electronic components of our robotic system, including but not limited to mechatronic design of the robot base, body, manipulator, sensors, actuators, grippers, connectors, power supply, etc. Debugging and testing the overall system, especially the performance of the hardware and the embedded software.
• Manage the relationship with our key external vendors.
• Work as an internal expert and consultant for other UBTECH teams.
• Track the state-of-the-art technology and conduct frontier R&D.
• Actively attend international conferences and forums, present our work, publish research articles, and file patents applications.
• Build connections and collaborations with academia institutions and industrial partners.
• Domestic and international travels required for internal meetings, external technical meetings, conferences, and partner discussions.
• Other duties may be required from time to time.
Basic Qualifications/Requirements:
• Advanced degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Industrial Engineering, System Engineering and related fields. Ph.D. preferred
• Proficient in one or several major mechatronic and SOC design software, including SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Altium Designer, PowerPCB, ORCAD, Xilinx, Altera, etc., with hands-on skills.
• Proficient in using mainstream microcontrollers and SOC devices for robotic control, signal processing, and communication systems.
• Experience in system integration and testing of mechatronic systems and the overall robotic hardware system.
• Trackable research work with strong publications in the area of robotic mechatronic system design.
• Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Self-motivated and passionate about the robotics and AI.
• Must be 18 years or older.
• Willing to work at different working locations when necessary.
• Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required.
Preferred Qualifications:
• 3 or more years of industrial experience in successfully conducting applied research or developing real robotic systems.
• In-depth expertise with technical fields relevant to robot hardware design with both system-level thinking and component-level development.
• Passionate about exploring new areas and implement innovative ideas and concepts in UBTECH’s products.
• Familiar with building embedded robotic platforms and implementing hardware related embedded software on microcontrollers.
• Customer engagement with solid skills of strategical thinking, business development, and excellent execution to meet business requirements and deadlines.
• Work both independently, with other team members, and lead teams in a dynamic, and fast-paced environment.
About Us:
UBTECH is a global leading AI and humanoid robotics company and the world’s most valuable AI and Robotics Start-up. At UBTECH, we conduct fundamental research, applied research, and innovative engineering to create various robotic products, which have been significantly impacting the global market and changing the world. As the leader in the intelligent service robot industry, we are the only company, which successfully commercialized humanoid robotic products for consumers, in the world.
Our mission is to bring a robot into every home, and truly integrate intelligent robots into the daily lives of everyone creating a more intelligent way of life.
The UBTECH North America Research and Development Center is the key business unit and R&D center of defining and creating the next-generation robotic products. We push the boundary of R&D of service robot industry and create game-changing robotic products which fundamentally influence the human and robot society.
Locations: Greater Los Angeles Area, CA.

Sr. Engineer – Cloud Network Operation 
 
Position Overview:
Tencent Overseas IT has the mission to empower Tencent’s rapid global growth with future ready, global IT platforms, applications and services. We are chartered to lead the Overseas IT strategy, architecture, roadmap and execution. Satisfying our internal/external customers and becoming a world class global IT team are our top aspirations.
 
Cloud Center of Excellence team is part of Tencent Oversea IT. The team will laser focus on providing infrastructure, best practice to enable Tencent’s dozens of oversea game studios.  The team will partner with game studios to define and deliver the best cloud and on-premise infrastructure for both game production and game runtime workloads.
 
We are seeking a long-term contractor Sr. Cloud Network Engineer with extensive cloud and on-prem network operation experience on at least one of the major public cloud platforms.
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
 
This senior role will closely work with our internal IT, as well 3rd party cloud providers (aws, azure and GCP) to provide cloud network design and operate the cloud in concern of security, performance, utilization, and cost. Our customers include internal or acquired gaming studios, innovative offices/workplaces, various business groups and external customers. The work scope will include understanding the internal customers’ business requirements, collecting the technical requirements, developing reference architecture and prototypes based on leading industry best practice, leading implementation and deployment for global locations, as well as issue troubleshooting when necessary.
 
He/she may have the following responsibilities:

Fixing network security issues of clients related to Firewall Rule base creation, VPN configuration, Nat and HA configuration
Implement different solutions and improve the stability and flexibility of the network with the best security features & creating documents for its configuration and installation
Support, monitor, and take care of existing configuration changes for on-premises and Multi Cloud Networks (AWS, Tencent Cloud, GCP and Azure)
Develop and implement strong knowledge on IP communication system along with required routing preferences of clients (OSPF, EIGRP, BGP)
Being able to understand and manage generic network monitoring and network performance test tool example SolarWinds and Iperf, etc
Engage in fixing the calls and support team and its users to resolve the problems
Take part in projects along with network engineering and help in supporting along with providing application plans
Interact with customers via phone or email to work towards fixing the network issues
Being compliant with team procedures, such as change management, Jira, ITSM, automation, and revision control

 
Based in Palo Alto, CA (open to other west coast locations), this person will work closely with the global Overseas IT team, HQ team to enable/deliver our global IT project portfolio. 
 
Who we are looking for: 

Self-motivated, articulate, passionate to deliver the best result and achieve the highest customer satisfaction. Quick learner.
Love satisfying customers with a state of art cloud solutions, realizing ideas, building services, and unlocking the potential of new technology!
Collaborative, independent, insistent, flexible, and open minded. And you see no conflict in any of these things.
Knowledgeable, resourceful and show initiative. You always keep the customer’s objectives in mind.
Positive by nature, a great team player, and both dependable and autonomous.
Customer oriented, and could work at a very fast pace;

 
Requirements

Can be remote on call on demand.
Must have 1+ years network operation experience with one of the following leading cloud solutions: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Ali Cloud, and Tencent Cloud. Experience in multi-cloud a big plus.
Solid cloud networking experience:


AWS direct connects, VPCs, Transit Gateways, SGs, ALB/NLB. 
CloudWatch / CloudTrail.
Next-gen firewalls (IDS/IPS, DLP, Content Filtering, Anti-malware, DDoS, etc). 
SIEM & SYSLOG. 
SFlow/NetFlow/Flowlog. 
Cisco ISR/ASR Routers, Cisco Nexus and Catalyst Switches. 
Generic Load Balancers and AWS ALB/NLB Load Balancers. 
BGP, OSPF Routing. 
Network Management and Monitoring Tools experience. 


Nice to have experience on helping business migrating from legacy infrastructure to cloud.


Can effectively collect, synthesize customer (for example internal and acquired game studios) needs and challenges, design/lead the establishment of global IT foundation architecture and solutions.
Can lead initiatives to integrate third party products and services to achieve design goals.
Contribute to define global cloud/infrastructure/architecture standards/guidelines.


Bachelor’s degree (or higher), Computer Science, Mathematics, or related science or engineering major
Lateral and logical troubleshooting, follow-through and problem-solving skills, resourcefulness, attention to detail, and communication skills, both verbal and written
Bilingual preferred (English, Chinese)

 
Nice to have:

Cisco Certified Network Associate (or similar equivalent) 
One or two public cloud SA certificates
Cloud ISV working experience or
On-premise SRE experience

About JD.com
JD.com is China’s largest online retailer and its biggest overall retailer, as well as the country’s biggest Internet company by revenue. JD.com sets the standard for online shopping through its commitment to quality, authenticity, and its vast product offering covering everything from fresh food and apparel to electronics and cosmetics. Its unrivalled nationwide fulfillment network provides standard same- and next-day delivery covering a population of more than 1 billion - a level of service and speed that is unmatched globally. As a technology-driven company, JD.com builds reliable and scalable platforms that bring value to partners and customers in sectors such as e-commerce, logistics, Internet finance, cloud computing and smart technology. For more information, visit www.corporate.jd.com
About JD Logistics
JD Logistics, a business group under JD.com, which leverages the company’s advanced technology and logistics expertise to provide smart supply chain and logistics services to businesses across a wide range of industries. JD.com has one of the largest fulfillment infrastructure of any e-commerce company in the world. JD.com is the only e-commerce platform in the world to provide small-to-medium sized warehousing, oversized warehousing, cross border, cold chain delivery, frozen and chilled warehousing facilities, B2B and crowdsourcing logistics. We believe technology innovation can drive smart logistics. JD built the world’s first fully-automated warehouse in Shanghai, and we are currently developing our own drones delivery and automatic delivery robots. For more information, visit https://www.jdl.cn/about

To ensure success as a Salesforce administrator, you should possess extensive knowledge of Salesforce system administration and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Didi Chuxing (“DiDi”) is the world’s leading mobile transportation platform. We’re committed to working with communities and partners to solve the world’s transportation, environmental, and employment challenges by using big data-driven deep-learning algorithms that optimize resource allocation.
 
Didi Chuxing’s Autonomous-Driving team was established in 2016, and has grown to a comprehensive research and development organization covering HD mapping, perception, behavior prediction, planning and control, infrastructure and simulation, labeling, hardware, mechanical, problem diagnosis, vehicle modifications, connected car, and security, among others. By connecting every workforce system to a single source of truth for employee data, businesses can automate all of the manual work they normally need to do to make employee changes. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can just click a button and set up a new employees' payroll, health insurance, work computer, and third-party apps — like Slack, Zoom, and Office 365 — all within 90 seconds.
 
Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $450M from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, and Sequoia—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes (#12 out of 500).
 
About The Role
The Identity team is responsible for the products and infrastructure that power connecting our customers to the external tools they use on a daily basis. The team owns multi-factor authentication, authentication settings, behavioral detection rules, RPass (Rippling’s zero-knowledge password manager), activity logging, IT third-party app integrations, VLDAP, and the authentication infrastructure that powers all Rippling products.
 
What You'll Do: 

Develop high-quality software.
Ship products at high quality.
Have very clear ownership of one or many product spaces.
Get exposure to the different company partners and our end-users, who will help provide feedback for your product space
Learn and understand how your product can help Rippling continually differentiate itself.

 
Qualifications:

5+ years of professional work experience
Experience building a large-scale platform for web and mobile apps
Expertise building complex distributed services
Strong CS knowledge
Bonus points if you’ve previously worked with AWS
You care about product ownership and solving problems for our customers.
You’re passionate about being in a product-focused environment where everyone cares deeply about customer impact.

Nylas is a pioneer and leading provider of productivity infrastructure solutions for modern software. Over 50,000 developers worldwide use the Nylas platform to quickly and securely build productivity features into their applications. With Nylas, developers get unprecedented access to rich communications data from their end-users, pre-built workflows that automate everyday tasks, embeddable UI/UX components for fast front-end development, and comprehensive security features-all delivered via a suite of powerful APIs that make integration easy.
Who We Are
Nylas was founded in 2013 and has raised over $175M to date from Tiger Global, 8VC, Spark Capital, Slack, and more; as well as individual investors including , Co-Founder and CEO of Stripe, , President and Co-Founder of Stripe, , CEO of Klarna, and . Developers around the world use Nylas to quickly and securely build email, scheduling, and work automation features into their applications. Nylas customers include Upwork, Wix, Freshworks, Lever, Dialpad, Ceridian, and Move.com.
 Our Work Philosophy
Nylas is also a big believer in the safety and well-being of our employees and society, which is why we are onboarding all new Nylanauts remotely during this global pandemic until there is a vaccine and it is safe for humans to their pre-COVID lifestyles.
AND once the COVID-19 pandemic eventually comes to an end, we will continue to embrace Remote First philosophy, with a minor twist:Remote First, Office Second. That's right! It's about how you work, not where you work. Nylanauts can choose any workspace or environment that will result in more ideas, engagement, creativity, focus, collaboration, and productivity. It's true. They can go anywhere as long as they respect the working hours (time zones) of their team. Wherever motivates them; inspires them to be better versions of themselves. This means Nylanauts can work from the slopes of Missoula before traveling to the beaches of San Diego. Wonderful!
And if Nylanauts want to work from an office in one of our hubs (San Francisco, Denver, New York City, Toronto, and London), they can. Go ahead! The workspace is there to be utilized.
Why Remote First, Office Second? Because we not only believe in respecting individual working styles, disabilities, and personal schedules, but also ensuring everyone has a better work-life balance. The outcomes will always be more important than the physical location.
So, if you’re looking to join a fast-growing company with a beloved, daily-use product, and an authentic mission that puts people first, we want to meet you.
Want to know more? Check us out on Comparably and Great Place to Work!

Drive and enhance the departmental OKRs and turn key results into dashboards that can be used to track progress

DevOps Engineer
Mountain View, California, United States · Engineering
DESCRIPTION
 
DataVisor is a next generation security company that utilizes industry leading unsupervised machine learning to detect fraudulent activity for financial transactions, mobile user acquisition, social networks, commerce and money laundering. Our solution is used by some of the largest internet properties in the world, including Yelp, Pinterest, Momo, and IGG, to protect them from the ever-increasing risk of fraud. Our award-winning software is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us!
 
 
 
We need a DevOps engineer with strong cloud services experience. You will create cloud services for multiple cloud providers. You’ll need to build the whole stack from Nginx to databases, and then move and launch our service at multiple sites.
 
In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with software engineering to deploy and operate our systems; help automate and streamline our operations and processes; build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations; and troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments. Also, you will help to develop world class highly efficient big data processing systems, using modern AI technology.
 
If you love building robust and scalable yet highly efficient systems, enjoy learning about new technologies, and want to work on a high-caliber team whose performance positively impacts every other engineer in the company, we’d love to talk to you.
REQUIREMENTS

Senior Software Engineer – Back-End (Java)
We're transforming the grocery industry
At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.
Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.
Introducing Our Hybrid Working Model
As the future of work evolves, so do we. We have a hybrid model where our roles are open to in-office, flex, or remote work.  Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.
OVERVIEW
Eversight - an Instacart company, is the recognized leader in AI-powered pricing and promotions. Global brands and retailers rely on the Eversight platform to optimize pricing in response to market conditions and to deliver higher ROI on promotional spend. Eversight’s Pricing Suite and Offer Innovation Suite solutions are driving strong margin and sales volume improvements for leading companies such as Coca-Cola, Frito-Lay, Raley’s, and Walgreens. Founded in 2013, Eversight recently joined Instacart in September 2022.
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to quickly hit the ground running and have impact on our core products. As part of our remarkably high performing, collaborative team of engineers, you will be involved in everything from product decisions to implementation details. With strong team support, significant freedom and self direction, you will experience the wealth of interesting, challenging problems. If this sounds like you’d be interested in, we’d love to hear from you!
Who You Are

You have a strong ability to self-regulate and problem solve through obstacles in a dynamic, fast-paced environment; maintains realistic estimations and escalates proactively when necessary.
You attack challenging and abstract problems by breaking them down into smaller problems, coming up with hypotheses, and proving or disproving them in a systematic way.
You are excited and enthusiastic about the prospect of tackling challenging problems.
You connect your code to the business problems being solved and translate effectively across business and technical boundaries.
You’re motivated to learn about and impact a new market.

Eversight Contractor Competencies for CPG Savings Team:

Excellent coding skills: Preferred Ruby and Go experience.
Demonstrable software architecture and testing skills: SOLID principles, Domain Driven Design, creating cohesive and loosely coupled systems, writing compositional code and applying dependency injection, effective testing (e.g. BDD and TDD), writing unit, integration, and acceptance tests. 
Operational excellence: Experience creating and maintaining alarms, monitors, logging, dashboards.
Outstanding collaboration skills: Strong team player who enjoys working closely day-to-day with others on a collaborative team towards common goals.
Experience with Agile principles and practices, including iterative and incremental development, user stories, responsiveness to change, continuous improvement, and working on self-organizing teams.
Strong ownership and initiative across all aspects of development.

Nice to Have Skills:

Lean engineering experience is a plus.
GraphQL, Snowflake, Rspec, Jira, AWS

What You’ll Do

You will work in fast-paced environment to help generate ideas and quickly turn them into robust, well-tested, functioning code (including but not limited to Java)
You will work with product management to define and prioritize future functionality.
You will operate in a modified scrum environment where we spec, estimate, and divide up work as a team and then manage ourselves independently.
You will peer review other engineers’ code to help identify bugs, performance issues, security issues, and provide feedback on code cleanliness.
You will play a key role in the development of best practices in software design, implementation, and coding standards.
You will produce exemplary code and deliver completed projects in the time promised.
You will perform unit and system level testing on their application and all affected systems.
You will implement all aspects of an application design including but not limited to: high-performance design, coding, caching mechanisms, state management, error logging, scalability, environment configuration, proper testing procedures, naming standards and all other aspects of good application design and development

What’s in it for You

You will experience the excitement of working at and growing with an expanding venture-backed SaaS startup where you can make a huge difference.
You will be part of an exceptionally talented team that retains a significant focus on personal and professional development.
You will be part of a significant period of growth for the business.

Location
Remote US
Contract Positions
At Eversight, we have both contractors and non-contractors. While the structure of compensation is different (balance of cash vs. equity, benefits, etc.), we are committed to offering competitive pay for both. Also, we do everything we can to decouple compensation from the day to day work. In terms of responsibilities, training and coaching, expectations, interactions with other employees, etc., contractors are indistinguishable from non-contractors.

AI is already improving our lives in all imaginable areas, many of which require AI to run on edge devices for reasons including practicality, cost, and privacy. However, in the AI industry today there is still no good solution available to design efficient models targeting increasingly diverse edge hardware platforms. As a result, it takes repeated manual design and training iterations for models to be deployed, which in turn demands an extraordinary level of energy and engineering time for AI to reach production. 
 
OmniML is a well-funded early-stage startup targeting these big gaps. OmniML is backed by established VCs and world-leading researchers and industry experts. Founded by professor Song Han, MIT EECS professor and experienced start-up founder, Dr. Di Wu, former Facebook engineer, and Dr. Huizi Mao, co-inventor of the “deep compression” technology coming out of Stanford. OmniML makes major ML tasks 10x faster and 30% more accurate on different edge devices. The core product offering is a training platform that automates model co-design, training, and deployment targeting GPUs, AI SoCs, and even tiny MCUs. Our technology has already demonstrated significant gains in model performance and cost reduction in the initial collaboration with large customers in multiple vertical markets. 
 
To embark on the journey, we are looking for bold leaders and strong technical individuals who share our vision and can grow together with us. You will be part of the founding team creating AI/ML software that will help hundreds of customers deploy powerful AI on 250+ billion edge devices. More specifically, we are looking for:
 
On the platform group, this role will be working on OmniML’s automated model
training/deployment pipeline.
Responsibility
  Design core, backend software components
  Build and deploy services in a heterogeneous environment
  Interface with the algorithm team and the hardware engine team to incorporate
their innovations
  Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system
resources
Requirement
  Master’s or bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or related technical field
  Strong programming skills with Python, C++, or other object-oriented languages
  Good understanding of efficiency, scalability, and stability of computer systems
  Great interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills
  Desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment
Bonus points:
  Experience building and deploying large-scale applications
  Experience with AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  Experience maintaining CI/CD and developer efficiency systems
  Experience in startups or high growth companies

Job description:
In this position, you will be a member of the system power architecture team and involved in all stages of the design cycle guiding the power-efficient design of the end-end solution.  
Typical spectrum of work includes:

Chipset and SoC level power modeling, analyzing and optimization
Provide power projection of end-to-end use cases for the future projects and establish power targets for the end-to-end system as well as HW cores
Design, implement power features and work with multi-function groups through the design cycle in realizing the power targets set forth at the inception of the project
Collaborate with different teams to analyze power of the Chipset and SoC components
Collaborate with different teams to develop system level and IP level power models for power projection and trade off analysis

Minimum Requirements:

Understand mobile SoC/Chipset power components
Knowledge of system level aspects of low power design and the ability to model and analyze power at system and core level
Solid foundation in Electrical Engineering, with the ability to work with spreadsheets and other custom modeling tools at a detailed level
Familiar with SoC architecture and its building blocks such as CPU, GPU, DSP, video, camera, DDR
Excellent analytical skills and drive to complete projects
Strong communication skills are a pre-requisite as the candidate will interface with a lot of different groups
Able to work with teams in different time zones

Desired Requirements: 

Excellent scripting skills using Python
Object oriented programming
Customized tool development
MS in computer or electrical engineering
3+ years of experience directly related to power topics
Excellent technical writing skills

BSEE is required.  MSEE/Ph.D. in electrical engineering with desired experience in PMIC/Mixed-Signal/Analog IC design is preferred.

In a multi-site multicultural project team, you are working on the design and implementation of innovative high frequency Power Management IC's (PMIC) for next generation mobile RF transceiver applications:


Design and develop innovative power management and power circuits and perform a transistor level schematic capture and design to bring advanced concept to tape-out.
Supervise layout work of assigned tasks and iterate designs based on parasitic extraction.
Participate in silicon bring up and characterization and documentation of circuit blocks at IPs
Support system level product integration and testing.Additional requirement for senior level position:
Work with cross-functional teams to develop power circuits and architectures for the Envelope Tracking (ET) sub-system.
Experience with RF transmitter path and Power Amplifier (PA) circuits and systems.
Experience in silicon characterization, debug and proven track record of delivering products to mass production.


Required skills/tools:


3 years of industry experience in designing PMIC circuits in CMOS technology and demonstrated good analytical abilities.
Direct hands-on full custom tape-out experience with one or more the following PMIC/Analog blocks: DC-DC buck, boost and buck-boost converters, Switched-Capacitor Converters, Linear regulators.
Expert understanding of CMOS power device physics, modeling, advanced circuit techniques and layout methodologies for optimal efficiency in power management and analog circuits
Proven track record of delivering completing complex designs that meet specifications on time.
Cadence Design Environment

San Diego (CA)

Familiar with DDR low level SW driver architecture.4. Familiar with basic algorithms on DDR resource scheduling.5. Experience of leading following areas for at least one SOC product: DDR bus interface architecture, DDR controller architecture, FPGA verification, DDR training and stability tuning and other end-to-end development experience.

SUMMARY:
Indigo is proud to promote an exciting opportunity for a Revenue Management and Bi Manager. The role will be based at Canada’s largest Airport during an exciting time of recovery. This is an opportunity to work on a $200M+ business and have direct input and responsibility to generate millions of dollars of impact. This role will play an important role influencing the 4Ps with an emphasis on Price through dynamic pricing and product development through advanced digital and ecommerce solutions.In addition to the above the role will manage and guide our GTAA Data Scientists, Commercial Analysts, and work closely with the GTAA and Airport operations teams to create, implement and drive incremental revenue management and BI initiatives. The key aim will be to drive revenue growth, understand our customers better and drive internal efficiencies whilst delivering analytical services to GTAA as per required.
This person is also responsible for analysing complex business problems using internal and external data to provide strategic business insight, as well as identifying and interpreting data trends and producing reports. The person will be a key leader for the team who uses effective data analysis and people management skills to drive results at the GTAAIn addition to the above, proficiency in analysing, manipulating, reviewing, and presenting large amounts of data is important. Ability to use various Business intelligence tools to provide insights to the business. Delivery of recommendations on price and product through deep analysis to generate additional top line revenue and/or cost efficiencies. Be the Business Intelligence Champion for the GTAA and liaise/work with fellow Champions across all Indigo Countries and external clients to maintain high standards. Assist in the on-going development of advanced analytical tools within the company and provide training to all levels of competence.
DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:• Lead, motivate and develop members of the team and drive results.• Increase revenue across the GTAA by analysing and extracting insight from multiple sources of data.• Analyse complex business problems and provide strategic and actionable recommendations through business insights.• Responsible for the integration to Indigo Analytics and assist in the on-going optimisation of products and prices for any new software’s at the GTAA including Advanced Ecommerce and digital solutions.• Understand market dynamics, pricing trends and research and log all findings including competitor database and special events.• Collaborate with various stakeholders and technical experts to identify revenue enhancement opportunities and operations efficiencies.• Maintain and create analytical reports and dashboards to monitor trends and detect outliers. This includes being responsible for the accuracy, quality & timeliness of all fixed/ad hoc reporting and dashboards.• Assist in developing a long-term Bi and REV MAN strategy for the GTAA to remain at the cutting-edge within the data industry.• Ensure the development of dynamic and visual reporting that clearly communicates trends and makes logical recommendations for the future.• Leverage strong business acumen, presentation, and communication skills to create and present analysis in a relevant, consumable, meaningful and insightful ways.• Manage and sign off the build of new reports and dashboards to a high standard for distribution to the GTAA and local operations teams.• Responsible for the maintenance of pricing tables, pricing structures and hierarchies, data cleansing, quality control, and account securities for GTAA.• Any other duties and responsibilities required as the needs of the business change at the GTAA.
REQUIREMENTS:Education:• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Maths or Computer Science.Experience:• 5 years + of experience in a revenue/yield management role, preferably in a leadership capacity.• Strong experience in using visualisation tools - MS Powerbi, IBM Tm1/Cognos, Tableau etc• Strong commercial product and pricing skills. B2C customer analysis and pricing recommendations• Demonstrated knowledge of converting large amounts of multi-faceted data into meaningful reports.• Strong data visualization skills and experience using various visualization tools. Experience with PowerBI/Tableau/IBM Cognos Bi or similar required.• Knowledge of IBM SPSS Predictive Analytics / IBM PAL is preferred, including linking of data sources, building cubes, and monitoring of chores.• Track history of collaborating with large clients and implementing Bi and advanced analytics solutions.
Skills:• Strong quantitative and analytical skills.• Advanced MS Office user, with a particular emphasis on advanced Excel skills (look-up functions, VBA macros, complex logical statements, charts pivot tables, etc.).• Effective communication and management skills and ability to work on multiple projects at one time.• Ability to articulate analyses to wide range of stakeholders at the GTAA and internal at Indigo• Elevated level of curiosity and investigative mind-set with an attention to detail and accuracy.• Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with all levels of the GTAA• Strong consultative skills including client account management• Ability to be approachable and facilitate coaching conversations with GTAA and Indigo Team.• Ability to motivate and lead others to overcome challenges (Never Ever Give Up Attitude).• Ability to encourage open expression of ideas and opinions.• Excellent teambuilding, organisational, evaluation and people skills.• Ability to develop clear and concise documentation.• Team Player.
Desirable Skills/Experience/Knowledge:• Dynamic pricing experience from Hotel, Airline, or retail industries.• SPSS (Predictive) Modelling.• Experience designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining a data base, and programs to manage data analysis efforts.• Microsoft PowerBi – DAX Coding – No essentialLocation:• On-Site at the GTAA + Working from home (In line with GTAA working policy)

About the job
About Tencent
Tencent is an Internet-based platform company founded in Shenzhen, China, in 1998. We use technology to enrich the lives of Internet users and assist the digital upgrade of enterprises. Our mission is "Value for Users, Tech for Good". We embrace a culture of teamwork & creativity and are driven by our values - Integrity, Proactivity, Collaboration, and Creativity.
 
We are growing our office in Amsterdam, Netherlands, and looking for top talent to propel us forward. Combining the results-oriented nature of a startup with the resources of a profitable and leading Internet company, Tencent EU offers a unique opportunity for aspiring individuals to thrive.
 
About Tencent Games
Tencent Games was launched in 2003 and has since grown into a leading global platform for game development, publishing and operations. We are dedicated to providing high-quality interactive entertainment experiences to players and currently offer more than 140 games, including PUBG MOBILE, Call of Duty Mobile and League of Legends, to hundreds of millions of players across over 200 countries and regions.
 
We are committed to exploring the full potential of games, leveraging the rich IP resources within Tencent that span across literature, anime, film, and television. In addition, we actively collaborate with game developers and publishers to create high-quality interactive entertainment experiences.
 
Responsibilities
-Develop and execute a short, medium and long-term plan for Tencent Games in EU.
-Analyze local market and identify new partnership opportunities of key partners in EU.
-Build and maintain relationships with the major business partners and platforms in the gaming space.
-Expand business and marketing cooperation of Tencent Games in EU region.
- Develop market research, main competitor analysis report to better support management decision-making.
-Travel, as necessary, to international locations, as a representative of Tencent Games.
 
Qualifications
- Bachelor degree or above.
- 5 years experience in BD, marketing of gaming companies, top mobile gaming companies is a big plus.
- A strategic thinker with the ability to conceptualize broadly across various solutions, yet enjoys operating at hands-on level.
- Passionate, committed, self-starter with high level of initiative, energy, ownership, and urgency, with a sincerely willingness to learn from global team members at all levels.
- Strong influencing skills and ability to communicate effectively with different internal departments..
- Fluency in English required with fluency in Mandarin a plus.
 
Benefits
· A diverse and inclusive work environment where you can connect with colleagues from around the world
· A safe and supportive organizational climate to continue to grow and hone your craft
· Basic benefits including paid annual leaves and long-service holiday award, flexible work arrangements, competitive commercial insurance and pension plan
· Featured benefits such as annual trips, gym membership, working lunch, Family Day, and other cultural events and festival gifts
 
Tencent EU is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Sr. Infrastructure Engineer (Remote)
Headquartered Long Beach, CA – our client is a company driven by a commitment to providing world-class service to shippers and truckers alike. They’re on a mission to solve a trillion-dollar puzzle and offer painless freight.
Led by experienced professionals from Amazon, Google, Facebook, Snap, and Salesforce, our client is seeking change agents who are excited to make a meaningful impact on an industry driving the U.S. economy. They are venture-backed by leaders such as Brookfield Ventures, GLP and Sequoia Capital.
About The Role:
The mission of the Infrastructure team is to provide the crucial building blocks to accelerate development across the entire engineering team, spanning the domains of cloud computing, SRE, CI/CD, and other developer tools. As a Senior Engineer on this team, you will be key in helping us improve our reliability and delivery velocity as we continue to grow our engineering team and product portfolio. You will have the opportunity to make an outsized impact on the future direction of our technical platform, processes, and culture. You should be comfortable and effective working remotely or with remote team members. To be successful, in addition to a strong technical background, you must also be an excellent communicator in all dimensions: able to truly listen and understand the most important challenges across the engineering org, while also being a champion and evangelist for the right technical solutions.
What You'll Do:
Evolve and improve our public cloud infrastructure and associated tooling (Terraform), with a focus on reliability, maintainability, and security.
Continuously maintain, apply best practices and improve our kubernetes platform.
Manage and expand our usage of Istio.
Optimize all aspects of the CI/CD build pipeline, reducing cycle time while maintaining a high level of quality/reliability.
Create libraries, tooling, and documentation to help accelerate development across the org while adhering to best practices.
Work closely with other engineering teams to develop a roadmap for improving our technical infrastructure and development tooling/pipeline. Identify and prioritize the key problems and bottlenecks.
Play a key support role during production incidents and related retrospectives.
Key player in the lifecycle of all projects, from technical design, implementation, deployment, to post-launch follow-up.
Develop an understanding of the logistics industry and the top-level business goals for the company, and align technology initiatives with these priorities
Your Experience Might Include:
5+ years relevant engineering work experience.
BS Degree in Computer Science or related field
or equivalent professional experience.
Experience working with public cloud. AWS (strongly preferred), GCP, Azure.
Track record of leading initiatives and working autonomously.
Strong communications skills, and ability to influence/educate across the entire org.
Ability to identify friction/barriers in the SDLC and create innovative solutions.
Automation: Familiarity with cloud computing and infrastructure-as-code frameworks such as Terraform / Pulumi / CloudFormation. Terraform or Pulmi strongly preferred.
Fluency with at least one or more modern programming languages such as Python, Golang, Ruby and Java.
Docker and Kubernetes. Experience administering clusters is a must.
Practical experience with CI/CD concepts and related tooling such as Spinnaker, ArgoCD, Jenkins, and CircleCI.
Track record of effectively collaborating remotely with a distributed team.
Bonus points
for experience with:
Service meshes like Istio or Linkerd.
Metrics/observability/tracing tools like Prometheus/Datadog/Logz/Jaeger.
Experience writing K8 operators and developing webhooks.
What you'll get:
Competitive Base Salary + Equity
Full Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
401K w/ company match
Vacation and Holidays

Nylas is a pioneer and leading provider of productivity infrastructure solutions for modern software. Over 50,000 developers worldwide use the Nylas platform to quickly and securely build productivity features into their applications. With Nylas, developers get unprecedented access to rich communications data from their end-users, pre-built workflows that automate everyday tasks, embeddable UI/UX components for fast front-end development, and comprehensive security features - all delivered via a suite of powerful APIs that make integration easy.
 
Who We Are
 
Nylas was founded in 2013 and has raised over $175M to date from Tiger Global, 8VC, Spark Capital, Slack, and more; as well as individual investors including Patrick Collison, Co-Founder and CEO of Stripe, John Collison, President and Co-Founder of Stripe, Sebastian Siemiatkowski, CEO of Klarna, and Tony Fadell. Developers around the world use Nylas to quickly and securely build email, scheduling, and work automation features into their applications. Nylas customers include Upwork, Wix, Freshworks, Lever, Dialpad, Ceridian, and Move.com.
 
People First
 
Nylas is a BIG advocate for the well-being of its employees, which is why we have embraced a People First philosophy. It’s about giving more autonomy and flexibility to our employees. It’s not about when, where or how the work is accomplished; it’s about adopting a mindset of velocity and trust when tackling the work. It’s about respecting individual working styles, disabilities, and personal schedules, but also ensuring everyone has a better work-life balance. The outcomes will always be more important than the physical location.
 
Nylanauts have the ability to decide the best workspace or environment that will result in more ideas, engagement, creativity, focus, collaboration, and productivity. Why? Because we want our employees to be great; because we are focussed on being a high-performing team. To achieve this mission, we remove barriers and offer more autonomy. So, Nylanauts are encouraged to find those environments that inspire them to be great. This means Nylanauts can work from the slopes of Montana or from the beaches of Italy.
 
And if Nylanauts want to work from an office in one of our hubs (San Francisco, Denver, New York City, Toronto, and London), they can! The workspace is there to be utilized.
 
So, if you’re looking to join a fast-growing company with a beloved, daily-use product, and an authentic mission that puts people first, we want to meet you. Want to know more? Check us out on Comparably and Great Place to Work!
 
Recent Awards:
 
Fastest Growing Companies (Inc 500)
2020 Great Place to Work (Great Place to Work)
2020 Best Places for Professional Development (Comparably)
2020 Happiest Employees (Comparably)
2020 Best Companies for Compensation (Comparably)
2020 Best Companies for Perks & Benefits (Comparably)
2020 Best Companies for Work-Life Balance (Comparably)
 
About the role
 
Nylas is working on a next-generation data platform. You will be involved in building out the new infrastructure on top of a more modern stack that offers horizontal scalability and improved operability. In addition, you will help design and implement data pipelines that feed into the AI/ML models and data warehouse. 
 
You need to not only understand how to operate, administer, and maintain databases but also how to really teach our people how to think about our databases. We don’t want to do everything for our developers; we want them to be doing things for themselves. But to do that, we need to teach them some of our specialized knowledge on database subjects to do what they need to do with our databases without having to go through us - where that makes sense. Some things that are particularly fiddly or difficult we would probably want to hold on to for ourselves.
Responsibilities
. Maintain, scale, and administer our large sharded MySQL database environment to be operational 24/7 (more than 100TB of DB storage, 71 primary-replica pairs, hosting 200 shards!)
. Ensure our clusters are healthy, scaling, performant, and cost-effective 
. Enforce security and auditing practices to maintain DB integrity  
. Help teach and encourage smart database practices
. Improve automation of our various database systems to help enable self-service (when it makes sense), and implement self-healing and resiliency
. Improve automated backup and restore systems
. Improve alerting - if it alerts and isn’t actionable, it’s not an alert! If something goes wrong and we don’t get alerted, we need a new alert! 
. Experiment and recommend new database engine upgrades and entirely new data stores (when they make sense)
. Document current DB processes/architecture to help plan for the future
Qualifications
. A few years of operating large-scale relational database systems (20+ servers) 
. Strong proficiency in MySQL database management including 
. Performance tuning, query optimization, index tuning
. Maintaining HA solutions using mha, orchestrator
. Setting up monitoring dashboards with meaningful metrics to help identify usage/performance trends
. Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git(Version Control)
. Knowledge of MySQL features, limitations, and underlying storage engines
. Familiarity with other SQL/NoSQL databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Vitess
. Basic understanding of developer technologies - Python, Ansible, AWS, Terraform
. Nice-to-have - experience building out data pipelines using Spark, Kafka, kubeflow, Beam, Dataflow
. Nice-to-have - ProxySQL experience
Perks/Benefits
. Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO): we take this very seriously as we care about the well-being of our employees
. Healthcare: 90% of medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family
. Retirement Plan: 401k & RRSP with a company match (super rare for a startup)
. Holidays: 14 paid annual holidays (New Year’s Day, Family Day, President’s Day, Good Friday, Indigenous People's Day, etc)
. Education Grant: annual learning & development perk
. Paid Parental Leave: 12 weeks parental leave (maternity & paternity)
. Voting/Election PTO: 4 hours of paid time off to vote in person or volunteer at a polling place

Job Description
The Tracking and State Estimation team develops cutting edge technologies to help our truck perceive the world. You will play an important role in creating novel algorithms to solve the most challenging perception problems and applying your solution to the fleet of trucks at scale. 
Example projects we are working on include:

Temporal association of data from multiple sensors, including camera, LiDAR, RADAR and more
Object tracking and state estimation in challenging real world scenarios
Encoding perception uncertainty and collaborate with prediction team to make the system safe and robust

What You’ll Do:

Formulate, design, and deliver innovative solutions to the most challenging perception problems
Initiate and lead new projects that advance the state-of-the-art
Enable and empower other engineers on the team through design, code reviews, and coaching
Collaborate with other engineers on system integration and cross functional efforts

What You’ll Bring:

Masters/PhD in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or other related fields.
3+ years of professional experience working with autonomous vehicles or robotics systems.
Extensive experience in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Robotics, or Probabilistic Modeling
Expertise in at least one of these areas: sensor fusion, multi-object tracking, statistical state estimation, time series and sequence modeling, or a similar field.
Track record of driving ML or Robotics research projects from conception to productization.
Production-quality coding skill in C++ and/or Python.

Preferred:

Experience in deploying algorithms and models into real-world real-time systems
Knowledge and expertise in performance optimization for CPU, GPU, or neural network applications

Senior Product Development Engineer, Electro Mechanical Design
at Cruise
San Francisco, CA
We're Cruise, a self-driving service designed for the cities we love.
We’re building the world’s most advanced, self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
Cruisers have the opportunity to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the forefront of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's an opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to play a part in making a positive impact in the world by advancing the revolutionary work of self-driving cars, join us.
Cruise is co-developing a Shared Autonomous vehicle or SAV with GM and Honda. As a Vehicle Engineer, you will be responsible for the hardware development of special variants to this base SAV as well as strategic base SAV development activities. This role requires you to work cross-functionally with Product, Operations and Design, reporting to our Vehicle Engineering lead.
An ideal candidate has extensive experience with the product development cycle of a vehicle. This would cover development of requirements, developing initial designs, hands-on prototyping, and working with manufacturers to develop and test these systems all the way to certification. The role would require one to think creatively and be agile in a field that is constantly evolving and improving.
What you’ll be doing:
· You’ll be part of a small, high visibility team at Cruise that works on special projects that look at opportunities to broaden the utility of the Origin platform.
· You’ll be developing electronics modules and bringing them to life for Origin variants. Working with internal experts you would need to develop initial designs and architectures. Based on your initial studies, you would create and manage engineering requirements for external suppliers.
· You’ll provide guidance on electronics module designs, custom PCBA level design; including but not limited to custom design work / board packaging, board thermals, board level EMC/EMI shielding, etc.
· You’ll provide guidance on electronics packaging, wire harness routing, and best practices for proper integration of electro-mechanical systems. Support in-vehicle assembly and mounting studies.
· You’ll work cross-functionally with various organizations within the Cruise family to ensure alignment with the organization’s broader goals - including but not limited to: Cruise Product and Design, Safety, Test and Reliability, New Business Initiatives, other supportive engineering families.
· You will need to work with suppliers and lead/provide guidance to their project teams as they execute on the details of the design strategy and early designs.
· You’ll support the development of testing and validation strategies on a variety of electro-mechanical projects at various stages of the product development process.
· You’ll closely work with our testing and reliability teams, our simulation experts, product and design engineers, and other supporting contributors.
· You’ll be working on a variety of parallel projects within the vehicles team - leading the design strategy and early development of our electro-mechanical systems.
· Challenging yourself everyday to think creatively in solving problems that need a fine balance of engineering performance, cost and aesthetics while meeting the strict safety standards that Cruise adheres to.
· Provide frequent, timely, and targeted updates to project leads.
What you must have:
· BS in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Automotive Engineering (or related field)
· 4 years of post-graduate Automotive or Aerospace design experience
· Ability to own and drive the development of electronics for various projects
· Strong rapid prototyping experience (Raspberry Pi., Arduino) - able to quickly turn an idea into a prototype
· Familiarity with CAE analysis relevant to sensor and module designs - thermal, shock, vibration, dynamics
· Experience with OEM or Tier 1 development processes
· Familiarity with certification testing
· Working level understanding of manufacturing processes for low and high volume production (stamping, injection molding, thermoforming, 3D printing, bending, etc)
· Good knowledge of DFMEAs or other quality management systems
· Strong need to be comfortable with change, ability to be self-directed, respond effectively in case of program ambiguities by driving cross-functional technical requirements
· Ability to create succinct technical reports with clear trade-offs and recommendations
Bonus Points!
· Familiarity with automotive safety regulation. Familiarity with FMVSS and ECE crash laws and developing hardware that complies to those laws
· Deep understanding of consumer product regulatory compliance testing and requirements: FCC, CE, VCCI, GMW, etc
· Experience designing high reliability and safety critical electronics hardware around telematics and multi-sensory HMI and actuation systems
· Strong CAD (SolidWorks, NX, Altium, OrCAD, Allegro, PADS, or ANSYS) capabilities. Familiar with PLM systems (Teamcenter preferred) in a full production environment
· Experience with active heating / cooling systems
· Experience with aftermarket niche manufacturing and working with external vendors
· Previous experience working in a consulting environment, with designers and new concept studies
Why Cruise?
· Our benefits are here to support the whole you:
· Competitive salary and benefits 
· 401(k) Cruise matching program 
· Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
· One Medical membership
· Flexible vacation and company paid holidays

· Flexible Spending Account

· We’re Integrated
· Through our partnerships with General Motors and Honda, we are the only self-driving company with fully integrated manufacturing at scale.
· We’re Funded
· GM, Honda, Microsoft, SoftBank, & T. Rowe Price, have invested billions in Cruise. Their backing for our technology demonstrates their confidence in our progress, team, and vision and makes us one of the leading autonomous vehicle organizations in the industry. Our deep resources greatly accelerate our operating speed.
· We’re Independent
· We have our own governance, board of directors, equity, and investors. Our independence allows us to not just work on the edge of technology, but also define it.
· We’re Vested
· You won’t just own your work here, you’ll have the potential to own equity in Cruise, too. We are competing in a market that is projected to grow exponentially, which gives our company valuation room to grow.

Description
DataVisor is a next generation security company that utilizes industry leading unsupervised machine learning to detect fraudulent activity for financial transactions, mobile user acquisition, social networks, commerce, and money laundering. Our solution is used by some of the largest internet properties in the world, including Pinterest, AirAsia, Synchrony Financial, Tokopedia, Letgo, Zomato and Ping An, to protect them from the ever-increasing risk of fraud.
DataVisor holds a rich product portfolio of AI as a platform and other SaaS products, such as feature platform, dEdge, rule engine, case management and dCube. Our award-winning software is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us!
Summary:
As platform engineers, we are building a next-generation machine learning platform, which incorporates our secret sauce, UML (unsupervised machine learning) with other SML (supervised machine learning) algorithms. Our team works to improve our core detection algorithms and automate the full training process.
As complex fraud attacks become more prevalent, it is more important than ever to detect fraudsters in real-time. The platform team is responsible for developing the architecture that makes real-time UML possible. We are looking for creative and eager engineers to help us expand our novel streaming and database systems, which enable our detection capabilities.
We continue to push the boundary of what's possible in fraud detection and data processing at scale. Join us to help usher in more innovative solutions to the fraud detection space.
What you'll do:
· Design and build machine learning systems that process data sets from the world’s largest consumer services
· Use unsupervised machine learning, supervised machine learning, and deep learning to detect fraudulent behavior and catch fraudsters
· Build and optimize systems, tools, and validation strategies to support new features
· Help design/build distributed real-time systems and features
· Use big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra) to build large scale machine learning pipelines
· Develop new systems on top of real-time streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka, Flink)
Requirements
· 5+ years software development experience
· 5+ years experience in Java, Shell, Python development
· Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate) is a plus
· Experience in Cassandra, HBase, Flink, Spark or Kafka is a plus.
· Experience in the Spring Framework is a plus
· Experience with test-driven development is a plus
